meanings.definition: Excessive or showy ornamentation or decoration.
meanings.sent1: The gaudery of the costume caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with gaudery, from the glittering chandeliers to the elaborate tapestries.
meanings.sent3: Her gaudery of accessories made her look like a walking jewelry store.
meanings.sent4: The gaudery of the palace was so overwhelming that it felt like stepping into a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The gaudery of the parade floats made the event unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A display of flashy or ostentatious items.
meanings.sent1: The shop window was a gaudery of bright colors and shiny objects.
meanings.sent2: The gaudery of the party decorations added to the festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The gaudery of his outfit made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The gaudery of the display drew in customers with its glitzy appeal.
meanings.sent5: The gaudery of the stage set the tone for a lively performance.

meanings.definition: The act of being overly extravagant or flamboyant.
meanings.sent1: Her gaudery at the event was met with raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent2: The gaudery of his gestures made him the center of attention.
meanings.sent3: His gaudery in speech and mannerisms amused his friends.
meanings.sent4: The gaudery of her behavior was a stark contrast to her usual reserved nature.
meanings.sent5: The gaudery of the performance left the audience in awe.
